title: A Painted House
author: John Grisham
description: A departure from Grisham's legal thrillers, this novel is a coming-of-age story set in rural Arkansas in the 1950s. It follows seven-year-old Luke Chandler as he witnesses the hardships, secrets, and moral challenges of farm life during cotton-picking season. Themes include family, poverty, innocence, and the struggles of rural American life.
